data.chText: （把…）烫坏，烧煳；烤焦（物体表面）
data.enText: to burn and slightly damage a surface by making it too hot; to be slightly burned by heat

data.chText: 我把自己的连衣裙熨焦了。
data.enText: I scorched my dress when I was ironing it.

data.chText: 别站得离火那么近——你的外衣都快烤焦了！
data.enText: Don't stand so near the fire─your coat is scorching!

data.chText: （使）枯黄，枯萎（尤指因曝晒或化学品的作用）
data.enText: to become or to make sth become dry and brown, especially from the heat of the sun or from chemicals

data.chText: 枯草
data.enText: scorched grass

data.chText: 在太阳底下浇水，叶子会枯。
data.enText: The leaves will scorch if you water them in the sun.

data.chText: 疾驰；飞驰
data.enText: to move very fast

data.chText: 汽车沿公路飞驰而去。
data.enText: The car scorched off down the road.

data.text: burn ♦ char ♦ blacken ♦ scald ♦ scorch ♦ singe

data.chText: 以上各词均含因高温或火导致损坏、损伤、毁灭之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to damage, injure, destroy or kill sb/sth with heat or fire.
burn

data.chText: 指（使）烧（或灼）坏、烧（或灼）伤、烧（或灼）死：
data.enText: to damage, injure, destroy or kill sb/sth with fire, heat or acid; to be damaged, etc. by fire, heat or acid

data.chText: 她把他的信全部付之一炬。
data.enText: She burned all his letters.

data.chText: 那所房子在1995年烧毁了。
data.enText: The house burned down in 1995.
char

data.chText: 指（使）烧黑、烧焦：
data.enText: [usually passive] to make sth black by burning it; to become black by burning

data.chText: 这些尸体已烧焦，无法辨认。
data.enText: The bodies had been charred beyond recognition.
blacken

data.chText: 指使变黑：
data.enText: [often passive] to make sth black

data.chText: 那里有一排砖房，全被烟熏黑了。
data.enText: There was a row of brick houses, blackened by smoke.

data.chText: 用char还是blacken？
char指烧黑、烧焦，blacken可指烧黑，也可指被烟或其他东西熏黑。
data.enText: Things that are charred have been burnt. Things can be blackened by fire or just by smoke, or by sth else entirely.
char or blacken?
scald

data.chText: 指因高温液体或气体而烫伤
data.enText: to burn part of your body with very hot liquid or steam
scorch

data.chText: 指把物体表面烫坏、烧煳、烤焦：
data.enText: to burn and slightly damage a surface by making it too hot

data.chText: 我把自己的连衣裙熨焦了。
data.enText: I scorched my dress when I was ironing it.
singe

data.chText: 尤指不小心把物体表面烤焦、烫煳：
data.enText: to burn the surface of sth slightly, usually by mistake; to be burnt in this way

data.chText: 他点烟时把头发给燎了。
data.enText: He singed his hair as he tried to light his cigarette.

data.chText: 用scorch还是singe？
scorched指被高温烫坏或被火烧煳；singed只用于被火或火舌烧焦。
data.enText: Things are scorched by heat or fire. Things can only be singed by fire or a flame.
scorch or singe?
to burn/scald yourself/your hand
to burn/scorch/singe your hair/clothes
burned out/charred/blackened/scorched remains/ruins/buildings
charred/blackened/scorched bodies/flesh/wood/paper

means: (使)枯黄，枯萎(尤指因曝晒或化学品的作用)

tr: a plant disease that produces a browning or scorched appearance of plant tissues
become scorched or singed under intense heat or dry conditions
example: The exposed tree scorched in the hot sun

tr: burn slightly and superficially so as to affect color
example: The cook blackened the chicken breast
The fire charred the ceiling above the mantelpiece

tr: destroy completely by or as if by fire
example: The wildfire scorched the forest and several homes
my eyebrows singed when I bent over the flames

value.def: To scorch something means to burn it slightly.

example.ex: The bomb scorched the side of the building.
example.tran: 炸弹烧焦了建筑物的一侧。

value.def: If something scorches or is scorched, it becomes marked or changes colour because it is affected by too much heat or by a chemical.

example.ex: The leaves are inclined to scorch in hot sunshine...
example.tran: 叶子在酷热的阳光下容易枯黄。

example.ex: If any of the spray goes onto the lawn it will scorch the grass.
example.tran: 这种喷雾剂向草坪上轻轻一喷，就会使草枯黄。

value.tran: (因过热或化学品的作用)(使)变色,(使)留有标记

example.ex: ...the lamp with its scorched plastic shade.
example.tran: 塑料灯罩已被烤褪色的台灯

value.def: If you scorch round a place, you move round it very quickly, either in a car or on foot.

example.ex: Many people dream of scorching round a racetrack.
example.tran: 许多人梦想能绕着跑道飞奔。
